org.wikipedia.miner.model
Class Article

java.lang.Object
  org.wikipedia.miner.model.Page
      org.wikipedia.miner.model.Article
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Anchor.Sense, Disambiguation
public class Article
extends Page

This class represents articles in Wikipedia; the pages that contain descriptive text regarding a particular topic. It is intended to contain all properties and methods that are relevant for an article, such as its pertinent statistics, the categories it belongs to, and the articles that link to it.

Author:
David Milne

          Represents a term or phrase that is used to link to a particular page.

Constructor Detail

Article

public Article(WikipediaDatabase database,
               int id,
               java.lang.String title)
Initialises a newly created Article so that it represents the page given by id and title. This is the most efficient constructor as no database lookup is required.

Parameters:
database - an active WikipediaDatabase
id - the unique identifier of the article
title - the (case dependent) title of the article

Article

public Article(WikipediaDatabase database,
               int id)
        throws java.sql.SQLException
Initialises a newly created Article so that it represents the article given by id.

Parameters:
database - an active WikipediaDatabase
id - the unique identifier of the article
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if no page is defined for the id, or if it is not an article.

a SortedVector of Redirects
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the Wikipedia database

getParentCategories

public SortedVector<Category> getParentCategories()
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a SortedVector of Categories that this article belongs to. These are the categories that are linked to at the bottom of any Wikipedia article. Note that one of these will be the article's equivalent category, if one exists.

Returns:
a Vector of WikipediaCategories
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getEquivalentCategory

public Category getEquivalentCategory()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the Category that relates to the same concept as this article. For instance, calling this for "6678: Cat" returns the category "799717: Cats" Note that many articles do not have equivalent categories; they are only used when the article describes a general topic for which there are other, more specific, articles. Consequently, this method will often return null.

Returns:
the equivalent Category, or null
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getLinksIn

public SortedVector<Article> getLinksIn()
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a SortedVector of Articles that link to this article. These are defined by the internal hyperlinks within article text. If these hyperlinks came via redirects, then they are resolved.

Returns:
the SortedVector of Articles that this article links to
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getLinksOut

public SortedVector<Article> getLinksOut()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a Vector of Articles that this article links to. These are defined by the internal hyperlinks within article text. If these hyperlinks point to redirects, then these are resolved.

Returns:
the Vector of Articles that this article links to
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getAvaliableLanguages

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getAvaliableLanguages()
                                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a Vector of language codes for which translations are available (i.e. fn, jp, de, etc).

Returns:
true if there exists a link from this article to the argument one; otherwise false.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the Wikipedia database

getTranslation

public java.lang.String getTranslation(java.lang.String languageCode)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the title of the article translated into the language given by languageCode (i.e. fn, jp, de, etc) or null if translation is not available.

Parameters:
languageCode - the (generally 2 character) language code.
Returns:
the translated title if it is available; otherwise null.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the Wikipedia database

                                                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a HashMap associating language code with translated title for all available translations

a HashMap associating language code with translated title.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the Wikipedia database

getRelatednessTo

public double getRelatednessTo(Article article)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException

Calculates a weight of the semantic relation between this article and the argument one. The stronger the semantic relation, the higher the weight returned. i.e "6678: Cat" has a higher relatedness to "4269567: Dog" than to "27178: Shoe". This is based on the links extending out from and in to each of the articles being compared.

The details of this measure (and an evaluation) is described in the paper:
Milne, D and Witten, I.H. (2008) An effective, low-cost measure of semantic relatedness obtained from Wikipedia links. In Proceedings of WIKIAI'08.

If you only cache inLinks, then for efficiency's sake relatedness measures will only be calculated from them. Measures obtained only from inLinks are only marginally less accurate than those obtained from both anyway.

The reverse is true if you cache only outLinks, although that isnt reccomended. They take up much more memory, and resulting measures are not as accurate.

Parameters:
article - the other article of interest
Returns:
the weight of the semantic relation between this article and the argument one.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database
